xhtml:tr.xhtml:td: Clients age is less than 1 year Today's date − "Date of birth" < 1 year: Today's date − "Date of birth" < 1 year Clients age is less than 1 year
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" Client is not due for cholera vaccination
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first cholera dose. Should not vaccinate client with cholera dose as clients age is under 1 year.
For WC vaccines (Shanchol, Euvchol and mORCVAX), 2 doses should be given 14 days apart to individuals aged ≥ 1 year.
WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1)

The latest cholera dose was administered less than 3 years ago Today's date − latest "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Cholera vaccines") < 3 years: Today's date − latest "Date and time of vaccination" (where "Vaccine type" = "Cholera vaccines") < 3 years The latest cholera dose was administered less than 3 years ago

"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" "Completed the primary vaccination series" (where "Vaccine type" = "Cholera vaccines") = TRUE Primary series is complete. Client is not due for cholera booster dose

Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first booster dose. Should not vaccinate client with cholera booster dose as primary series was completed less than 3 years ago.
Revaccination is recommended where there is continued risk of Vibrio cholerae infection. For WC vaccines, revaccination is recommended after 3 years.
